intro: Amberboa zanjanica, commonly known as the Zanjan amberboa, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, spicy aroma. Amberboa zanjanica is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand hot, dry conditions.
